thread.title: For U.K., China Ties Worth Costs of Breaking Ranks With West
thread.title_full: For U.K., China Ties Worth Costs of Breaking Ranks With West

author: info@worldpoliticsreview.com (Andrew Small)
title: For U.K., China Ties Worth Costs of Breaking Ranks With West
text:
U.K. Prime Minister David Cameron welcomes Chinese President Xi Xinping, London, Oct. 21, 2015 (10 Downing St. photo by Georgina Coupe). For U.K., China Ties Worth Costs of Breaking Ranks With West Andrew Small Friday, Oct. 23, 2015 
Chinese President Xi Jinping’s visit to the United Kingdom this week has largely attracted the wrong kind of headlines. Reactions from experts and officials in the United States and across Europe have been scathing, ranging from the bemused to the disturbed. Many contend that Britain’s China policy, at the instigation of Chancellor of the Exchequer George Osborne, has been reduced solely to matters of commerce. Not only do strategic matters in Asia, human rights concerns and threats to democracy in Hong Kong appear to be virtually absent from the U.K.’s considerations, the British government gives the impression of believing that this is a necessary precondition for the economic relationship between the two sides to thrive. ... ×
